lexUnit.name: regret.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel or express sorrow, repentance, or disappointment over.

sentence.text: We regret that we are unable to answer multiple queries that do not comply with these instructions .
We regret that tickets can not be exchanged .
The Publishers regret that under no circumstances will the magazine accept liability for non-receipt of goods ordered , or for late delivery , or for faults in manufacture .
He regretted that , but the awful truth was only a murmur away .
At least he 'd made someone happy , he thought drily , regretting that he 'd snarled at the lad in front of him .
Freshers applying after 1st September will receive assistance in finding suitable accommodation : we regret that we can not guarantee University accommodation in such cases .
Queen 's Press Secretary regrets separation row
We regret we are unable to cater for people with physical disabilities .
She regretted she would not be seeing Urquhart again for only one reason , or so she told herself .
Quex regretted he had ever told anyone about the things he had discovered in the churchyard , realising too late they were as corrupt as Gabriel 's mutilated body .
If he had regretted his kiss the evening before , how on earth was he going to view what had just happened between them ?
" Do you regret what you 've done ? " she asked , moving around so that she was able to look at his face .
Was he regretting what had happened between them ?
` If you truly regret what you left behind in Milano , if you prefer it to what I offer you here , then I will have you flown back there first thing in the morning . "
` Ladies and gentlemen , I regret to have to inform you that , due to an accident to Mr. Banks , we will be unable to continue the performance . "
Now I regret to say that the only political party that actually entered into negotiations on this occasion was the Conservative Party .
` Do you regret accepting this job , then ? "
He regretted leaving Myeloski alone in the afternoon .
Some cloners think Sun regrets making previous Sparcstations too easy to knock off so it 's putting some obstacles in the way .
Cyril Reenan sold the tape to a newspaper for six thousand pounds , but he says he regrets ever recording it and is going to give the money to charity .
Walker starts to regret starting conversation .
She bit her lip instantly , regretting her outburst as much as she regretted ever catching his gaze at that ill-fated cocktail party .
I deeply regret my being unable to be with you and to join the memorial service and the dedication together with the related activities .
But you 'd regret it in the long run , I think , would n't you ?
He regrets the fashionable attacks on critics .
He chose Everton over Arsenal and will regret that decision to his dying day .
She started to regret her impulsiveness in joining a wild-goose obstacle chase .
By the third year she was beginning to regret her choice :
I think she had gone into maths teaching and had then regretted it .
Perhaps he 's regretting his impulsive offer .
Hudson fixed her with such a smile that she instantly regretted the question .
Winnie felt that this could lead to somewhat alarming disclosures which might be regretted by all .
( Its position at the front of the volume was later regretted by Wordsworth as some readers were put off . )
The departure of Sir Reginald Dorman-Smith was regretted by those who shared his emphasis on the political issues .

It is regretted that so many people were unable to obtain a ticket for this game and the committee fully appreciates their keen disappointment ; it was an impossible task to satisfy everyone so great was the demand .
Failure is not a moment to be regretted in a process of adaption , or development into normality , which ideally takes its course .
` It is much to be regretted , that the owner of the Purse Crag should have cut down the beautiful trees , which served so wonderfully to enrich the prospects on this side of the water .
But Richard Wilson says he regrets the fact that units like the Ritchie Russell have to find money from outside the NHS .
We certainly do n't regret the move but wish we 'd known how much work and cost would be involved .
Office Cleaning Services says it regrets the situation and has the utmost sympathy for Mrs Hampton .
We regret the things we failed to do , we reproach ourselves for things we did do and feel relief that we have moved on .
It was a decision which he regretted for some years , although within the university he proved an effective teacher and he was dean of the faculty of science from 1894 until 1913 .
It was an agreement that Lear was to regret bitterly in later years .
Mr. Thorpe is now ill with Parkinson 's disease , a fact known and regretted throughout north Devon and further .
He says he regrets with great penitence and sorrow the circumstances that led to the caution .
It was a change Rory regretted bitterly .
George regretted more than ever his forgetting of Nigel .
But was it a life choice that Bob ever regretted ?
Do n't try to do too much in one day or you will end up making impulse buys that you will regret , and do n't buy things just because they are cheap .
When she did , she was capable of doing and saying things she afterwards regretted .
When I started work I regretted not going for a degree , but promised myself not to miss out .
And it 's a , it 's a tendency which I think we shall regret .
Hall said on Monday that he regretted the miserable humanitarian situation in Iraq while visiting a hospital in the Mansour district of the Iraqi capital .
